name: ImportProducts

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

B.name: CustomPropertyTypes
B.description: Custom properties used in product content can be defined by specifying their definition in this collection.

B.name: DownloadImagesInBackground
B.description: When not specified, or explicitly specified as `false`, images will be downloaded while you wait and may cause this service to run for a long time. Defaults to `true`.

B.name: ImageBlobCategory
B.description: A string that identifies the category in which the ProductImages will be stored. It's optional, when not provided the SystemID will be used instead.

B.name: LayerName
B.description:
The layer on which the content will be stored. Defaults to 'ImportProducts-Base'. If you want to store the content on a different layer, you can specify it here. If the content also
specifies a language/country this will be combined with the provided layer name to create a layer name like '<name> <language> <country>', so the provided LayerName is not necessarily the absolute
value that is used for the layer, only if you leave LanguageID/CountryID as null on the content.

B.name: Products
B.description: The list of products to create or update. If a product does not exist it's created and if a product with the same ID and SystemID already exists it is updated.

B.name: RootLogicalLevel
B.description:
The LogicalLevel that will be assigned to the root level of a product hierarcy. If not specified a default value is used.

See ProductVariation.LogicalLevel for more information.

B.name: SystemID
B.description:
A string that identifies the system that was used to call this service. In combination with a product's ID, this is what uniquely identifies the product in EVA.
The SystemID must be the same for every call, if it's different from a previous call then new products will be created.

B.name: Type
B.description: Determines the behavior of this service.

B.name: WaitForProductComposition
B.description:
By default this service only blocks for the time that it takes to store the requested modifications. After that time, some processing still needs to happen before the product is fully ready and searchable, but this happens in the background.
If this parameter is specified as true then this service blocks for the full duration that it takes to complete the full process.

C.name: CategoryID
C.description: The ID of the category the property falls into. Defaults to `default`.

C.name: CopyToParentProductPropertyTypeID
C.description:
If provided, the values of this property will be copied to the provided property on the parent products.
This can be useful if you have a `clothing_color` property on the `color` logical level and would like to have an `available_colors` property on the root level that contains all the colors that are available for the product.
In that example the value of the CopyToParentProductPropertyTypeID on the `clothing_color` property would be `available_colors` and the value of the CopyToParentProductPropertyTypeID on the `available_colors` property would be null.
If there is no property yet with this name, it will be automatically created with the same data type as the source property.

If there already exists a property with this name, the data type must match the data type of the source property and the IsArray property must be true as the parent products will be given multiple values from their children.

C.name: DataType
C.description: Defines the data type of the property.

C.name: IndexType
C.description: Defines whether and how the content of this property is searchable. Note that this is a flags enum so IndexType can both be IndexedNotAnalyzed and IndexedAnalyzed, meaning the field will be indexed in an analyzed *and* a non-analyzed manner.

C.name: IsArray
C.description: Determines if the property allows multiple values or if it's just a single value.

C.name: ProductPropertyTypeID
C.description: The ID of the custom property, by convention in snake_case.

F.name: Assortments
F.description: If specified this will add the product to those assortments.

F.name: Barcodes
F.description: An (optional) list of barcodes for this product. A barcode should be globally unique and any duplicate barcodes will result in an error.

F.name: Brand
F.description: The (optional) brand of the product. Only has to be specified on the root level of a hierarchy.

F.name: CommodityCode
F.description: The CommodityCode is used for customs declarations and product tariffs. Can be used to store the HS code of the product.

F.name: Content
F.description:
The per-language content of the product.

A small set of default properties has been defined, such as Name and MarketingDescription. Additional content can be defined inside `CustomContent`, which is a key-value container
where the key is the name of a property and value should be a single scalar value (string, number, boolean or null) or an array of values.

If LanguageID is left null, this will be the fallback content for languages that have no content of their own.
For example, you may offer a French website but you only have English product content, if you specify your English content with LanguageID = null
then products on the French website will have the English content.

In general, it's a good idea to choose a language that will serve as the default fallback language and to not specify LanguageID for that language's content so it will function as the fallback content.

F.name: CountryOfOriginID
F.description: The country of origin for the product. Value must conform to the 2-letter country code as defined by ISO 3166-1.

F.name: CustomID
F.description: The custom identifier for the product.

F.name: GiftCardConfigurationID
F.description: In case a type GiftCard product is uploaded, its `GiftCardType` or `GiftCardConfigurationID` is mandatory to connect to its provider.

F.name: GiftCardData
F.description: In case a type GiftCard product is uploaded, this defines the optional data for configuration.

F.name: GiftCardIsDigital
F.description: In case a type GiftCard product is uploaded, this defines if the product is digital, so it will not require a serialnumber during checkout.

F.name: GiftCardType
F.description: In case a type GiftCard product is uploaded, its `GiftCardType` or `GiftCardConfigurationID` is mandatory to connect to its provider.

F.name: ID
F.description: The unique identifier for the product.

F.name: ImagesWillBeInheritedByChildren
F.description:
Determines whether or not any images set on a parent product will inherit down to its children. This defaults to true.
Can be useful to give the root product of a hierarchy an ensemble of the available colors, without inheriting these images to the children.

F.name: IsDeleted
F.description: Set to `True` to delete the product.

F.name: LedgerClassID
F.description: The (optional) ledger class ID of the product. Only has to be specified on the root level of a hierarchy.

F.name: ManufacturerID
F.description: Optional field that can be used to store the manufacturer's identifier for this product.

F.name: Name
F.description: The culture independent name of the product by which it can be recognized even if it otherwise does not have any content. Required unless Type = ContentOnly.

F.name: ProductRequirements
F.description: Optional field to set up the product requirements on a product.

F.name: RequireSerialNumberForSale
F.description: Optional field to indicate a serialnumber will be required when selling this product.

F.name: SerialNumberConfigurationID
F.description: Optional field to indicate what kind of serial number requirements apply to this product.

F.name: Status
F.description: Defines the status of a product.

F.name: TaxCode
F.description:
The TaxCode determines how sales tax applies to this product. This must refer to an existing TaxCode in EVA, if it doesn't exist yet an error is returned.

Required unless Type = ContentOnly.

The string expected here is the Name property of the tax code, so 'High' for TaxCode High.

EVA defines the following default tax codes:

- High
- Intermediate
- Low
- Zero
- Exempt

In a hierarchy, the TaxCode only has to be specified for the root level; all products part of the hierarchy will always have the same TaxCode.

F.name: Type
F.description: Defines what kind of product it is. If the product is part of a hierarchy, this is only relevant for the SKU level, all other levels will have type Configurable.

F.name: UnitBarcodes
F.description: An (optional) list of barcodes with the associated quantity and unit of measure for this product. A barcode should be globally unique and any duplicate barcodes will result in an error.

F.name: VariationValues
F.description:
Defines the per-language value of the variation property for this product. For example, if the variation property is `color` then the value could be 'red' or 'blue'.

If the variation value isn't language sensitive then the LanguageID should be left null. If there isn't an item where LanguageID is null, all languages for which this product has content must have
a value for the variation property.

F.name: Variations
F.description: Defines the variations hierarchy of the product.

H.name: DeliveryOnly
H.description: The product won't be available for endless aisle pickup from shop.

H.name: DisableBackorder
H.description: The product won't be orderable if there is no available stock.

H.name: DisableDelivery
H.description: The product will be unavailable for delivery.

H.name: DisablePickup
H.description: The product won't be available from a shop at all.

H.name: PreRelease
H.description: The product will be unavailable until the pre-order date.

H.name: UseUp
H.description: Indicates the product won't be back in store and all current stock is all there is going to be.

I.name: PublicationStatuses
I.description: The publication status determines the visibility of the product. A product generally won't be visible to non-employee users unless it has publication status 'public'.

J.name: ID
J.description: The unique identifier for the image. Optional, if null then an ID is generated based on the hash of the ImageUrl

J.name: ImageData
J.description: The raw image data. Only required if ImageUrl is left empty.

J.name: ImageUrl
J.description: Where can the image be downloaded? Required unless ImageData is provided.

J.name: IsPrimaryImage
J.description:
If an image is specified as IsPrimaryImage = true then it will be used as the primary image on the product.
If there is for some reason multiple images for a product that have IsPrimaryImage set to true then the last image that have this set will become the actual primary image.

J.name: LocationType
J.description: How the image should be stored. Usually empty.

J.name: MimeType
J.description: The image mime type. Optional, if null then the mime type will be guessed by the ImageUrl

J.name: Name
J.description: The human readable name of the image. Optional, if null then the name will be the ID of the image.

J.name: Sequence
J.description:
The sequence number of the image, can be used to determine the display order of images and will be used to determine the primary image of the product.

Smaller numbers mean a higher priority.

By default this will be null and the sequence of the images will be determined by their ordering in the Images array.

The number provided here does not necessarily translate to the actual sequence number stored in EVA, only the relative order will be used. Given the sequence 1, 2, 4, 7 the actual sequence stored in EVA
will be 0, 1, 2, 3.

O.name: AllowCustomPricing
O.description: Indicates if custom pricing on the product is allowed.

O.name: BundleProduct
O.description: Indicates the product is of a bundle type.

O.name: Insurance
O.description: Indicates if the product is an insurance product.

O.name: Service
O.description: A non-physical product that represents a service of some sort.

O.name: Stock
O.description: A normal stock-keeping product. This will be the default if not specified.

P.name: Barcode
P.description: The barcode of the product. Must be unique.

P.name: Quantity
P.description: The quantity of the product (in the given unit of measure) that the barcode represents.

P.name: UnitOfMeasureName
P.description: The name of the unit of measure to use for this barcode. If not specified, 'Each' will be used. Must be created beforehand.

Q.name: CountryID
Q.description: Can be left null if the variation value isn't culture dependent.

Q.name: LanguageID
Q.description: Can be left null if the variation value isn't culture dependent.

R.name: LogicalLevel
R.description:
The LogicalLevel of a product defines the 'level' on which the product can be thought to sit in the hierarchy.

For example, the various different colors of a shirt can be thought to have LogicalLevel = 'color' and the actual SKU might have LogicalLevel = 'size' or 'sku'.

You are free to use any value, but it's recommended to keep this consistent between all products, or at least between products of the same kind, as it's a useful way to
structure a frontend by for example filtering on the color level and only show sizes when navigating to the product detail.

R.name: Products
R.description: The actual variations of the product on the specified LogicalLevel.

R.name: Property
R.description: The property on which the product hierarchy varies. For example 'size' or 'color'.

T.name: CreatedProductIDs
T.description: The EVA IDs of the products that were newly created by this call.

T.name: PreviewResult
T.description: If the Type of the request was PreviewOnly this property will contain the product structure that would be generated.

T.name: ProductMap
T.description: Contains an entry for every product mapping the input string ID to its internal EVA integer ID.

T.name: UpdatedProductIDs
T.description: The EVA IDs of the products were touched by this call.

U.name: Code
U.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

U.name: Message
U.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

U.name: RequestID
U.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

U.name: Type
U.description: A short description of the error type.

V.name: ExternalIDs
V.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

V.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
V.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

V.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
V.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
